content: On October 4, 1995, the Atlanta Braves clinched the National League Division Series by defeating the Colorado Rockies 4-3 in Game 4. This victory marked the Braves' first postseason series win since relocating to Atlanta and set the stage for their remarkable run that year, culminating in a World Series championship. Fred McGriff's critical home run in the game was a highlight, showcasing the offensive power that would propel the Braves through the playoffs.
